availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Grigsby (Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Grigsby. Father of John T. Grigsby, Henry T. Grigsby, Columbus W. Grigsby, Finnetta Grigsby, Barzilla W. Grigsby, Ann C. Grigsby, Ellen Grigsby, and Nancy Grigsby. Farmer in Spencer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Spencer County in 1850. Farmer in Nelson County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 2, p. 103B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 2, p. 23.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 258-9.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 125B.
